intro: Eriocaulon phatamense, commonly known as the Phatamense flat sedge, is a flowering plant species belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance, with narrow, grassy leaves and small, clustered inflorescences. The plant typically grows in wetland or marshy environments, thriving in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Its flowers are usually inconspicuous, with tiny, spike-like structures that produce wind-pollinated seeds. Eriocaulon phatamense plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity in its native habitat.
